newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Creative down S$2.00 on profit taking.
newsitem.headline: Creative down S$2.00 on profit taking.

text.p: Multi-media company Creative Technology saw Singapore $2.00 wiped off its share price in the opening 10 minutes of trade in Singapore on Tuesday as profit takers moved in to capitalise on the counter's stunning S$2.70 gain on Monday, dealers said.
"Profit taking was expected -- it's a correction after yesterday's big gains," said a local dealer.
Creative's share price leapt up on Monday after the company reported better than expected interim results at the weekend, showing a 111 percent net profit rise to US$56.93 million.
Analysts said they had doubled full-year net profit forecasts after the interims with ranges of between US$116 million and US$123 million for the 1997 financial year.

However, analysts are concerned about Creative's longer term prospects into 1998. "The short to medium term is good but the longer term is weaker," said one. The fall in Singapore follows an overnight slide in Creative's U.S. stock listing.
